questionListItems.title: Is there a user guide on Career GRIT?

answer.body: Yes, there is a step-by-step user guide on Career GRIT, you can access it here.

SMS OTP is a one-time password sent to your registered mobile number with the sender ID “Career GRIT”. The aim of the SMS OTP is to secure your account.   

For security purposes, please do not share your OTP with anyone.

questionListItems.title: I used to be able to find SSG and WSG information on the same website but now there are two different websites. How do I find information easily on both websites?

answer.body: The joint SSG and WSG website was launched in 2016 and over the years, each organisation’s brand and programmes have grown and gained traction among Singaporeans. User feedback and research on the joint website’s usability showed that user experience has declined, largely due to the size and complexity of the website. Hence, the decision to reorganise the content from the joint SSG and WSG website into two separate websites for better user experience and to allow users to find relevant content more readily.

questionListItems.title: Where can I find out more about the services and programmes offered by WSG?

answer.body:
Our website provides comprehensive information on our services and programmes. If you are unable to find the information you require, you can contact us through WSG service portal at www.wsg.gov.sg/serviceportal 

 

Click here if you wish to contact us

questionListItems.title: How do I know if the SMS that I received was sent by Workforce Singapore?

answer.body:
WSG has registered “WSG” and “WSG and e2i” with the Singapore SMS Sender ID Registry (SSIR). To ensure that the SMS you received is indeed from WSG, please ensure that the sender is either “WSG” or “WSG and e2i”. Non-registered SMS will be labelled as “Likely-SCAM” (refer to example below).

Nonetheless, please remain vigilant as scammers may use variations of a legitimate sender ID to attempt to trick unsuspecting recipients.

questionListItems.title: What does it mean when I receive an SMS labelled as “Likely-SCAM”?

answer.body:
If you received an SMS supposedly from WSG with the header “Likely-SCAM”, it would have been sent by a non-registered SMS account and you are advised to ignore it. Do not click on any links or log into websites via such links. If unsure, do contact us via our hotline (6883 5885) or Service Portal with a screenshot of the SMS for further assistance during our call centre operating hours (Mondays to Fridays 8.30am to 5.30pm, Saturday 8.30pm to 1.30pm). For incidents after operating hours, please file a police report via:

  • Police hotline at 1800 255 0000
  • Online Police Report
  • Any nearest Neighbourhood Police Centre or Post

questionListItems.title: What should I do if I receive a phishing email, call or SMS?

answer.body:
If you notice any calls or emails that you suspect to be scams, or websites that you suspect to be fake versions of the official WSG and MyCareersFuture websites, please reach out to WSG via our hotline (6883 5885) or Service Portal with a screenshot of the SMS or email for further assistance during our call centre operating hours (Mondays to Fridays 8.30am to 5.30pm, Saturday 8.30pm to 1.30pm). For incidents after operating hours, please file a police report via:

  • Police hotline at 1800 255 0000
  • Online Police Report
  • Any nearest Neighbourhood Police Centre or Post

questionListItems.title: What should I do if I had responded to a phishing email, call or SMS resulting in monetary or information loss?

answer.body:
In the unfortunate event you fall prey to a scam and have incurred monetary loss, loss of personal information, or discovered that your online account has been hacked or compromised, file a police report immediately:

  • Police hotline at 1800 255 0000
  • Online Police Report
  • Any nearest Neighbourhood Police Centre or Post

You should provide the following information when filing a police report:

For online scams
If a scammer had told you to access a website to key in your banking details or do online trading (phishing and investment scams), or asked you to download a mobile application from a website, you can report the link by keying in the full URL of the scam website visited, which may be from shortened URLs, (e.g. Tinyurl, Bit.ly). Refer to your Internet browser history to retrieve the full link. This allows for the authorities to take action against the website.

For phone scam
If you have fallen prey to a scam, you can report the phone number used by the scammer by entering the entire string of numbers with no spacing in between numbers (omit dashes) in your police report. Please indicate if the number has a ‘+’ prefix. For example: +65123456789
Do state the type of call made, e.g. normal call, WhatsApp, Telegram, IMO, Viber, etc.

questionListItems.title: How do I avoid falling prey to phishing scams?

answer.body:
Please stay vigilant and beware of scam or phishing attempts. Here are some tips on how to protect yourself against phishing scams pretending to come from WSG:

  • Do not share your Singpass ID / password or banking details with anyone. WSG officers will NOT ask for your Singpass or iBanking userids and passwords.
  • Stay vigilant and only click on links from trusted sources. Always log in to your account from the official WSG websites. To determine if a link will lead you to a malicious website or is reliable, you can hover your mouse over the link to view the full address. For mobile devices, you can hold your finger down on the link so that a window pops out and shows you the full address of the link.
  • Verify the sender:
    - For email, ensure that the sender’s email address is correctly spelt and ends with @wsg.gov.sg or @ssg-wsg.gov.sg.
    - For SMS, ensure that the sender is either from “WSG” or “WSG and e2i”. We will not send SMS from other IDs.
    - Telephone calls from WSG officers to you will not begin with a prefix "+65". If a call has a prefix with a plus (+) sign, it is likely to be an overseas call.
  • Messages from WSG may contain links to the WSG website or other Government websites. Please check that the domain of such links end with “.gov.sg” before clicking on them.
  • Do report any suspicious call or digital notifications spoofing WSG via our hotline (6883 5885) or Service Portal during our call centre operating hours (Mondays to Fridays 8.30am to 5.30pm, Saturday 8.30pm to 1.30pm). For incidents after operating hours, please file a police report via:
    • Police hotline at 1800 255 0000
    • Online Police Report
    • Any nearest Neighbourhood Police Centre or Post

questionListItems.title: Can Careers Connect guarantee me a job after attending the workshop/group tutorial?

answer.body:
The hiring decision remains with the prospective employers. Careers Connect can help you be more employable by:

  • Identifying your strengths and interests, and
  • Improving your job search skills through our Career Energiser workshops/group tutorials.

questionListItems.title: How can I register for a Career Energiser workshop/group tutorial?

answer.body:
The Career Energiser workshop and group tutorial is only for registered Careers Connect client who is being career-coached as follow up sessions by client’s Career Coach are required after each workshop/group tutorial to support client in putting the learning into practice.

If you are already being assisted by a Careers Connect Coach, approach them to register for the workshop/group tutorial.

You can also register for WSG’s public workshops and webinars here .

questionListItems.title: Do I have to pay for the Career Energiser workshops/group tutorials?

answer.body: Our Career Energiser workshops/group tutorials are complimentary.

questionListItems.title: How do I cancel or reschedule a Career Energiser workshop/group tutorial I registered for?

answer.body:
Complete the reschedule/cancellation form in your workshop/group tutorial confirmation email, and we will contact you should you wish to join the next available session.

Kindly note there are limited slots per workshop/group tutorial. We would appreciate advance notice of cancellation, preferably 3 days in advance, so that we can release the lots to other clients.

questionListItems.title: How are Career Energiser workshops/group tutorials different from those being run by other organisations and training providers?

answer.body:
Most career skills workshops cover similar career development concepts, theories and skills. Here’s how Career Energiser workshops are unique:

  • Specially curated for Careers Connect clients.
  • Emphasis on hands-on practice with personal guidance from certified WSG Career Coach.
  • Complements the 1-to-1 career coaching services by certified WSG Career Coach.

questionListItems.title: Are there any assessments or exams for the Career Energiser workshops/group tutorials?

answer.body: There are no assessments or exams. We encourage you to work on your key areas of concern after the workshops/group tutorials and schedule a follow-up with your Career Coach.
